snippet: The change of heart on immigration among evangelical Christian leaders is trickling down to congregations, and it could have a powerful effect on the fight in Congress.
abstract: Change of heart on immigration among evangelical Christian leaders, once inclined to view illegal immigrants as lawbreakers, is trickling down to congregations, and could have powerful effect on fight in Congress; many pastors in largely white churches have been spurred to action on immigration by preachers in Hispanic and immigrant churches, who have seen rapid growth in their congregations.
lead_paragraph: The change of heart on immigration among evangelical Christian leaders is trickling down to congregations, and it could have a powerful effect on the fight in Congress.

headline.seo: Evangelical Christians Increasingly Favor Pathway to Legal Status for Immigrants
headline.main: For Evangelicals, a Shift in Views on Immigration
headline.print_headline: As Evangelical Leaders Change Views on Immigration, Congregations Follow
